# How to Embed AI Chatbots into Your Website: A Step-by-Step Guide

AI tools

Chatbots

June 14, 2023

### ‍ **Embedding AI tools in your website**

In this blog post, we’ll show you exactly how to embed AI tools and chatbots
into a website, step by step.

Businesses are flocking to add AI into their websites. The most creative
businesses are adding intelligent chatbots to deliver customer support, funnel
sales, and even answer FAQs.

For example, robotics automation provider Formic uses a chatbot to answer
customer questions about their products.

Customers who land on the web page can ask detailed questions and receive
detailed answers instantly. No waiting, no customer loss, no friction.

The embedded chatbot delivers real value to website visitors.

Let's dive in!

###  **How are businesses adding AI to their online presence?**

 **‍** A common question small online businesses ask is something along the
lines of, "How can I add ChatGPT to my website?"

They don’t necessarily mean “How do I put ChatGPT into my website”. What they
really mean is how do I customize ChatGPT with directions, save that
customized version of ChatGPT, and embed it into my website as an interactive
chatbot?

Well, it’s not that hard. With prompt templates, you can create a guided
ChatGPT experience and embed it onto your website so customers can use it.
Similarly, you can embed AI tools into an internal workspace like Notion or
Sharepoint so that co-workers can use the ChatGPT the way you use it.

Pickaxe makes it easy to add AI chatbots into any website.

Check out this website that offers a personal AI writers room for
brainstorming, writing, and editing copy.

Screenshot of Inck.ai, a personal AI-powered writing suite

Before we discuss how to add AI to your website natively, let’s quickly
discuss WHY.

### ‍ **Why should you add AI to your website?**

 **‍** A lot of small businesses or solopreneurs offer “professional
services”. This includes all kinds of “knowledge work” like consulting,
marketing, coaching, etc. Services that _don’t scale._

 _‍_ Or at least not historically.

However AI, especially Large Language Models like ChatGPT, offer workers to
ability to scale previously unscalable services.

If you are a marketing consultant who helps clients rewrite their sales
pitches according to your system, you give a lot of the same advice over Zoom
calls, email threads, and phone calls. Your time is the limiting factor to
your productivity. Since you can’t scale your time, you can’t scale your
business and serve more customers.

But with the onset of Large Language Models, now you can. It’s easy to design
a prompt that provides that same expertise you do. By turning transforming
your expertise into an interactive chatbot, you can now serve numerous
customers at once.

Customers' basic needs can be met by your AI chatbot. For more involved needs
they still contact you.

You just outsourced a huge part of your job to your AI chatbot!

Delivering dynamic AI content allows small businesses to scale their services.
If you can emulate part of your process with a chatbot, you can serve many
more customers simultaneously.

### ‍ **How to embed AI chatbots into your website**

 **‍** Let’s dive into how to embed an AI chatbot into your website.

#### ‍ **Step 1 - Create a chatbot**

 **‍** The first step is to create an AI chatbot through Pickaxe. Pickaxe is a
free, simple way to create a chatbot that requires no code. You can build
chatbots in the Pickaxe Chatbot Builder or you can build a widget in The
Pickaxe AI Widget Builder.

Making a tool is fairly simple. Write a prompt, add user inputs where you want
people to insert their own values, and then customize the design. For a more
detailed walkthrough, you can watch the how to make a pickaxe tutorial video.

Remember, the art of prompt design is important. The better prompt you write,
the better your chatbot will perform. The best practices of designing a
chatbot are debated, but generally it’s good to follow OpenAI’s GPT Best
Practices guide.

#### ‍ **Step 2 - Choose Embed Options**

 **‍** Embedding the chatbot into a website is easy. After you’ve made a
chatbot on Pickaxe, you can go to a page to manage the pickaxe. Just click the
“embed” button.  

In the embed customization page, you can customize the look, design, size, and
branding of your AI tool to fit your specifications.

#### ‍ **Step 3 - Paste embed code into your website**

 **‍** To add the chatbot to your website, just copy and paste the embed code.
It’s that easy!

‍

If you’re building your own website, you can embed the chatbot directly into a
website’s HTML. But Pickaxe also works on no-code website builders like Wix,
Wordpress, Webflow, and more! Users love Pickaxe because the process requires
no code! Embedding your chatbot is as simple as copy and pasting.

Here’s a walkthrough for most popular website builders and workspaces.

‍

### ‍ **How to embed AI chatbots using different website builders**

 **‍** You can embed AI chatbots into Notion with ease. Just add a new block
by clicking the “+” button. Scroll down to look for the “Embed” option. Click
it and paste in the pickaxe embed link!

‍

You can embed AI tools into Webflow easily as well. It’s as simple as adding
an “embed element” on the add panel. Then just paste the embed link into the
box!

The embed block on webflow

Embedding chatbots into Squarespace, Wix, Wordpress, Sharepoint is just as
easy. Look for adding an element for "embed code", dragging it into your
website, and then pasting in the pickaxe embed code.

**‍** Adding AI widgets in a website or workspace is really that simple! Build
a tool, customize the embed, paste in the embed link!

Once a pickaxe is embedded, it's fast, flexible, and easy to manage. Users can
always adjust the prompt and settings without needing to change the embed
code. The chatbot will update automatically.

### More Examples of Embedded Pickaxes

As a final bonus, we want to share two more excellent integrations of AI into
a website.

Mike Rosen runs an AI coaching service called Caasper AI. He created and
embedded a chatbot in his website to engage his customers and guide them
through how to intelligently use AI in their services.

Check out Mike Rosen's chatbot on his Caasper AI site here.

Adam Aragon runs a AI-powered Dungeon Master that walks you through games of
